page.title: 07CROFTING TODAY
page.content: NO ONE IN SHIELDAIG TODAY LIVES BY CROFTING ALONE. THE WALLED ENCLOSURE IS NOW USED FOR ROUGH GRAZING, ALTHOUGH THE LIVESTOCK ARE STILL TURNED OUT IN THE SPRING, WHEN POTATOES AND HAY ARE GROWN. THE NURSE KEEPS CHICKENS ON THIS GROUND AND THE ONLY COWS ARE A HIGHLAND COW AND HER CALF. A FEW HORSES GRAZE HERE IN THE WINTER AND ARE USED FOR PONY TRECKING BY THE TOURISTS AND LOCAL CHILDREN. THE PEOPLE WHO OWN CROFTS NOW MAKE THEIR LIVING IN OTHER WAYS _ FISHING BUILDING OR THE SERVICE INDUSTRIES. THE LAND IS NOW GIVEN OVER TO SHEEP REARING. THEY GRAZE ON THE CROFT AND THE LAND SURROUNDING THE VILLAGE, EVEN IN THE VILLAGE ITS SELF. THEY WILL DEVASTATE YOUR GARDEN IF YOU INADVERTENTLY LEAVE THE GATE OPEN.
